intro: Commelina lugardii, commonly known as the African spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have three blue or violet petals with white or yellow markings. Commelina lugardii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and along stream banks.
